section.title: list pricing schedules creating new List Pricing Schedule Item
section.para: To create a new list pricing schedule item, select the NEW button. The following screen will appear:
When creating a new list pricing schedule item, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify which type of list pricing schedule item you want to create: Nominal, Discount, or freight. The screen will present different options depending on which type option you select.

section.para: Select the "Nominal" option for simple quantity break pricing by item. When the "Nominal" option is selected, you will be presented with the following choices:

listitem.para: Enter the item number of the item you want to add to the list pricing schedule. The lookup feature located to the right of the field leads to a searchable sold items list. Multiple sold items may be assigned to a single list pricing schedule.
Inventory unit of measure.

varlistentry.term:
quantity breaks in list pricing schedules
list pricing schedules quantity breaks in Qty. Break

listitem.para: Enter the lowest quantity of the specified item that must be purchased to receive the specified price. The quantity break is measured in the inventory unit of measure. Multiple quantity breaks may be assigned to a single item.

varlistentry.term: list pricing schedules pricing detail for Price

listitem.para: Enter the price the specified item may be purchased for if the specified quantity break is met. The price is measured in the price unit of measure.
Displays the list price for the specified item.

Specify the unit of measure (UOM) to be used when selling the line item. Sold items may be assigned multiple Selling UOMs. These alternate UOMs may be defined on the Item master. You may also select a global conversion ratio here. Global conversions have the label Global appended to them. If a line item has no Selling UOM defined, then the inventory UOM will be used here by default.

tip.para: When using a Selling UOM for the quantity break, you may not select an alternate price UOM. The reason for this is that selling UOMs use the same UOM for both quantity and pricing.

listitem.para: Specify the price unit of measure to be used with the specified quantity break UOM. If you select a Selling UOM for the Qty. UOM, you will not be able to select a price UOM. For Selling UOMs, the Selling UOM and the price UOM are the same.
Displays the ratio between the price and inventory Units of Measure for the specified item.
Displays standard cost and actual cost for the specified item.
The margin is determined by the following formula: Price - Cost / Price.

section.para:
list pricing schedules configured item pricing and
configuration pricing for If the specified item is a configured item, then the "Characteristics" tab will be available. Characteristics for configured items can carry their own list prices. These characteristic prices may be added to the base price when configured items are sold. To define characteristic pricing for configured items, select the "Characteristics" tab. The following screen will appear:
When defining characteristic pricing for configured items, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: List displays all the characteristic prices which have been associated with the list pricing schedule item.

section.para: To add a new characteristic pricing item, select the NEW button. The following screen will appear:
When adding a new characteristic pricing item, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select a characteristic from the list of item characteristics defined for the specified item.
Select a value from the list of values defined for the specified item characteristic.
Enter a new price for the characteristic and value combination. This alternate price will be used in place of the standard characteristic list price when the list pricing schedule is used.

Displays the default list price for the item characteristic. The list price for characteristics is added to the base price of sales order items when the characteristic is specified at sales order entry time. List pricing schedules are designed to override standard list prices.

section.para: Select the "Discount" option for fixed amount or percentage based discount pricing by item. For list pricing schedules, only discounting by item is available. Discounting by product category is not available for list pricing schedules. To enter discounts by item, select the "Item" option. The following screen will appear:
When discounting by item, you will be presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify the item you want to add to the list pricing schedule.

listitem.para: Enter the lowest quantity that must be purchased to receive the specified Discount.

varlistentry.term: list pricing schedules discount percentage for Discount Percent (List Price)

listitem.para: Enter the Discount percentage off list price to be used when the specified quantity break is reached.

Enter the fixed amount you want to be discounted off the list price. If a Discount percentage is also used, the fixed amount will be subtracted after the Discount percentage. However, the price can never go below zero.

section.para: Select the "Markup" option to calculate the price as a markup on the wholesale price.
When the "Markup" option is selected, you will be presented with the following choices:

listitem.para: Select this option if the Markup depends on the item that is selected. You will be prompted for the item number.
Enter the item number this list pricing schedule item will be applied to.
Markup by product category is not available for list pricing schedules.
Enter the lowest quantity that must be purchased for the specified Markup to be applied.
Enter the Markup Percent that needs to be added to the inventory cost.
Enter the Fixed Amount the inventory cost will be increased by.

note.para: The inventory cost will be increased with the sum of the Markup Percent and the Fixed Amount.
